Body: Mary is baking a cake. The recipe calls for 6 cups of flour and 13 cups of sugar. She already put in some cups of flour. If she still needs 8 more cups of flour than sugar
Question: How many more cups of flour does she need to add?

Body: Winter is almost here and most animals are migrating to warmer countries. 27 bird families flew away for the winter from near a mountain. If there were 41 bird families living near the mountain initially
Question: How many bird families were left near the mountain?

Body: Jake has 16 fewer peaches than Steven. Steven has 15 more peaches than Jill. If Jill has 12 peaches
Question: How many more peaches does Jill have than Jake?

Body: A book has 2 chapters. The first chapter is 60 pages long. If there are a total of 93 pages in the book
Question: How many pages are in the second chapter?

Body: Paul got a box of some crayons for his birthday. During the school year he gave 563 crayons to his friends while he lost 558 crayons. If he only had 332 crayons left
Question: How many crayons did he get for his birthday?

Body: At the stop 13 more people got on the bus. Initially there were 4 people on the bus.
Question: How many people are there on the bus now?

Body: Julia played tag with some kids on monday. She played tag with 14 kids on tuesday. If she played with a total of 16 kids
Question: How many kids did she play with on monday?

Body: Baker's friend bought 137 cakes from him. If he had made 169 cakes initially
Question: How many cakes would baker still have?

Body: Jerry had 5 action figures and 9 books on a shelf in his room. Later he added 7 more action figures to the shelf.
Question: How many more action figures than books were on his shelf?

Body: For 19 weeks of harvest Lewis earns a total of $ 133.
Question: How much money does he earn each week?
